# Enterprise SaaS Master Service Agreement

## 1. Preamble and Identification of Parties

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a dense, professionally drafted legal text suitable for a Master Services Agreement (MSA), a complex Commercial Contract, or a high-level Partnership Agreement. It utilizes standard boilerplate architecture combined with rigorous identification protocols.\n\n***\n\n# 1. PREAMBLE AND IDENTIFICATION OF PARTIES\n\n**1.1. EFFECTIVE DATE AND FORMATION.** This [Agreement Type, e.g., Master Services Agreement] (hereinafter referred to as the **“Agreement”**) is made and entered into as of this [Day] day of [Month], [Year] (the **“Effective Date”**), by and between the following legally constituted entities, which may be referred to individually as a **“Party”** and collectively as the **“Parties.”**\n\n**1.2. IDENTIFICATION OF PROVIDER.** [Full Legal Name of Company A], a [State of Incorporation/Formation] [Entity Type, e.g., Corporation or Limited Liability Company], having its principal place of business and registered office located at [Full Street Address, Suite, City, State, Zip Code] (hereinafter referred to as the **“[Short Name, e.g., Provider or Seller]”**). This identification shall include all authorized subsidiaries, affiliates, and permitted successors-in-interest who may, from time to time, perform obligations or exercise rights under this Agreement.\n\n**1.3. IDENTIFICATION OF RECIPIENT.** [Full Legal Name of Company B], a [State of Incorporation/Formation] [Entity Type, e.g., Corporation or Limited Liability Company], having its principal place of business and registered office located at [Full Street Address, Suite, City, State, Zip Code] (hereinafter referred to as the **“[Short Name, e.g., Client or Buyer]”**). This identification shall include any entity that, now or hereafter, controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with the aforementioned entity.\n\n**1.4. RECITALS AND STATEMENT OF INTENT.** This Agreement is predicated upon the following mutual acknowledgments and representations, which the Parties hereby incorporate into the substantive body of this Agreement:\n\n*   **WHEREAS,** the [Provider] represents and warrants that it possesses the requisite professional expertise, technical infrastructure, personnel, and specialized knowledge necessary to provide [Detailed Type of Services/Goods] (the “Deliverables”);\n*   **WHEREAS,** the [Client] desires to engage the [Provider] to perform such services or provide such goods as more specifically detailed in the subsequent Articles and any appended Statements of Work (SOW) or Exhibits;\n*   **WHEREAS,** the [Provider] is willing to perform such services and/or provide such goods under the terms and conditions set forth herein; and\n*   **WHEREAS,** both Parties represent that they have the full legal power and authority to enter into this Agreement, that the execution of this Agreement has been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action, and that this Agreement constitutes a valid and binding obligation, enforceable against each Party in accordance with its terms.\n\n**1.5. CONSIDERATION.** NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants, representations, and warranties set forth herein, and for other good and valuable consideration—the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged by the signatures of the authorized representatives below—the Parties, intending to be legally bound, hereby agree as follows:\n\n**1.6. CAPACITY AND AUTHORITY.** Each individual executing this Agreement on behalf of a Party represents and warrants that they are duly authorized to execute and deliver this Agreement on behalf of said Party, and that this Agreement is binding upon said Party in accordance with its terms, notwithstanding any internal limitations on authority not disclosed in writing to the other Party.\n\n**1.7. SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS.** This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Parties hereto and their respective permitted successors, heirs, executors, administrators, and assigns, subject to the restrictions on assignment set forth in Section [X] of this Agreement.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 2. Recitals and Background

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a comprehensive, high-density template for the **Recitals and Background** section of a sophisticated commercial agreement. It uses formal "Whereas" clauses to establish the legal context, the intent of the parties, and the foundational facts underpinning the contract.\n\n***\n\n### 2. RECITALS AND BACKGROUND\n\n**WITNESSETH:**\n\n**2.1 Historical Context and Corporate Standing.**  \nWHEREAS, [Party A Name], a [Jurisdiction] corporation (hereinafter referred to as “[Party A]”), is a market-leading entity engaged in the primary business of [Detailed Business Description], possessing extensive proprietary systems, intellectual property, and operational infrastructure essential to the [Industry] sector; and\n\n**2.2 Specialized Expertise and Representation.**  \nWHEREAS, [Party B Name], a [Jurisdiction] [Entity Type] (hereinafter referred to as “[Party B]”), represents and warrants that it maintains a specialized proficiency in [Specific Technical/Professional Field], supported by a robust framework of human capital, technical resources, and professional licensure requisite for the execution of high-level [Project/Service Type] services; and\n\n**2.3 Strategic Alignment and Commercial Objective.**  \nWHEREAS, the Parties have engaged in extensive preliminary due diligence and negotiations concerning a strategic commercial alignment (the “Transaction”) intended to optimize [describe goal, e.g., supply chain efficiencies, technological integration, or market expansion] through the collaborative application of their respective resources; and\n\n**2.4 Prior Understandings and Supersession.**  \nWHEREAS, the Parties previously entered into a [Name of Document, e.g., Letter of Intent or Memorandum of Understanding] dated [Date], and now desire to formalize their relationship into a definitive, legally binding instrument that supersedes all prior oral or written communications, expressions of intent, or informal arrangements regarding the subject matter herein; and\n\n**2.5 Inducement and Reliance.**  \nWHEREAS, [Party A]’s decision to engage [Party B] is predicated upon [Party B]’s specific representations regarding its capacity to deliver [Product/Service] in strict accordance with the performance benchmarks and regulatory compliance standards detailed in the subsequent Articles of this Agreement; and\n\n**2.6 Mutual Benefit and Consideration.**  \nWHEREAS, the Parties acknowledge that the execution of this Agreement provides a mutual commercial benefit and that the covenants, conditions, and obligations set forth herein constitute good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged by the signatures of the authorized representatives below; and\n\n**2.7 Definitive Purpose.**  \nWHEREAS, the Parties intend for this Agreement to govern the entirety of their professional conduct, risk allocation, and economic relationship pertaining to [The Project/The Services], ensuring a transparent framework for dispute resolution, indemnification, and the protection of Confidential Information (as defined in Section [X]).\n\n**NOW, THEREFORE,** in consideration of the foregoing premises, which are hereby incorporated into and made an essential part of this Agreement, and the mutual covenants and agreements herein contained, the Parties, intending to be legally bound, hereby agree as follows:\n\n***\n\n### Key Elements Included in this Draft:\n*   **The "Whereas" Structure:** Traditional legal architecture used to provide "extrinsic evidence" of intent, which is vital for judicial interpretation.\n*   **Capacity & Competence:** Explicitly states that both parties have the expertise they claim to have, which prevents "lack of capacity" defenses later.\n*   **Integration Clause Language:** Sets the stage for the "Entire Agreement" clause by noting that this document replaces previous drafts or letters of intent.\n*   **Inducement:** Establishes that Party A is only signing because they rely on Party B’s specific promises, which is crucial in fraud or misrepresentation litigation.\n*   **Consideration Affirmation:** Explicitly acknowledges that both sides are getting something of value, protecting the contract from being voided as a "gift" or a one-sided promise.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 3. Definitions and Rules of Interpretation

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a comprehensive and professionally drafted legal section for **"3. Definitions and Rules of Interpretation."** It is designed for use in complex commercial contracts, such as Master Service Agreements (MSAs), Share Purchase Agreements (SPAs), or high-value Technology Licenses.\n\n***\n\n### 3. DEFINITIONS AND RULES OF INTERPRETATION\n\n**3.1 Definitions.** \nUnless the context otherwise requires, capitalized terms used in this Agreement shall have the meanings ascribed to them in **Annex A (Defined Terms)**, or as otherwise expressly defined within the specific Clause or Section in which they first appear. Any capitalized terms used but not defined herein shall have the meaning commonly attributed to them within the [Industry Type, e.g., SaaS/Construction/Financial Services] industry in the jurisdiction of the Governing Law.\n\n**3.2 Rules of Interpretation.** \nIn this Agreement, except where the context otherwise requires:\n*   **(a) Gender and Number.** Words importing the singular shall include the plural and vice versa; words importing any gender shall include all genders (including masculine, feminine, and neuter).\n*   **(b) Persons.** References to "persons" shall include individuals, bodies corporate (wherever incorporated), unincorporated associations, partnerships, trusts, joint ventures, governments, agencies, and states, whether or not having separate legal personality.\n*   **(c) "Including".** The words "include," "includes," and "including" shall be deemed to be followed by the phrase "without limitation" and shall not be construed as words of limitation or as an exhaustive list.\n*   **(d) Headings.** The table of contents, headings, and sub-headings contained in this Agreement are inserted for convenience of reference only and shall not affect the interpretation, construction, or validity of the substantive provisions of this Agreement.\n*   **(e) References to Clauses and Schedules.** References to Clauses, Sub-clauses, Sections, Schedules, Exhibits, and Annexes are, unless otherwise specified, references to the clauses and sections of, and schedules, exhibits, and annexes to, this Agreement. All such Schedules, Exhibits, and Annexes are incorporated herein by this reference and form an integral part of this Agreement.\n*   **(f) Statutes and Regulations.** Any reference to a statute, statutory provision, enactment, or subordinate legislation is a reference to it as it is in force as of the Effective Date and as it may be amended, consolidated, extended, re-enacted, or replaced from time to time, and shall include any orders, regulations, instruments, or other subordinate legislation made under it.\n*   **(g) Drafting Party.** The Parties agree that this Agreement is the product of joint negotiation and has been reviewed by respective legal counsel. Accordingly, the rule of construction that any ambiguity is to be resolved against the drafting Party (*contra proferentem*) shall not apply to the interpretation of this Agreement.\n*   **(h) "Herein" and "Hereunder".** The words "herein," "hereof," "hereto," and "hereunder," and words of similar import, refer to this Agreement as a whole and not to any particular Section, Clause, or subdivision.\n*   **(i) Time Periods.** References to "days" shall mean calendar days unless "Business Days" is expressly stated. If the final day for the performance of an obligation or the exercise of a right falls on a day that is not a Business Day, the time for such performance or exercise shall be extended to the next succeeding Business Day.\n*   **(j) Calculation of Time.** In the computation of periods of time from a specified date to a later specified date, the word "from" means "from and including" and the words "to" and "until" each mean "to but excluding."\n*   **(k) Successors and Assigns.** References to any Party shall include that Party’s permitted successors, receivers, managers, and permitted assigns.\n*   **(l) Currency.** Unless otherwise specified, all references to "dollars," "currency," or "$" shall refer to the lawful currency of the United States of America (USD).\n\n**3.3 Order of Precedence.** \nIn the event of any inconsistency, ambiguity, or conflict between the various documents comprising this Agreement, the following order of precedence shall apply (in descending order of priority):\n1.  Any formal amendments or variations to this Agreement executed by the Parties in writing subsequent to the Effective Date;\n2.  The main body of this Agreement (Clauses 1 through [X]);\n3.  The Annexes and Schedules to this Agreement;\n4.  The Exhibits to this Agreement;\n5.  Any Statement of Work (SOW) or Purchase Order (PO) issued hereunder, unless such SOW expressly states that it overrides a specific provision of this Agreement by citing the Clause number to be superseded.\n\n**3.4 Language.** \nThis Agreement is executed in the English language. If this Agreement is translated into any other language, the English language text shall prevail in the event of any conflict in interpretation or translation.\n\n**3.5 Internal References.** \nReferences to "this Agreement" include this document and all schedules and instruments supplemental to or collateral with this document or which are expressed to be supplemental to this document.\n\n**3.6 Ejusdem Generis.** \nThe *ejusdem generis* rule of construction shall not apply to this Agreement. Accordingly, general words shall not be given a restrictive meaning by reason of their being preceded or followed by words indicating a particular class of acts, matters, or things.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 4. Structure of Agreement and Orders

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a formal, comprehensive legal draft for **Section 4: Structure of Agreement and Orders**. It is designed for use in a Master Service Agreement (MSA), Professional Services Agreement, or Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Framework Agreement.\n\n***\n\n### 4. STRUCTURE OF AGREEMENT AND ORDERS\n\n**4.1 Framework Nature of Agreement.** This Agreement constitutes a master framework under which the Customer may, from time to time, procure Services, Deliverables, or Cloud Services from the Provider. This Agreement sets forth the general terms and conditions applicable to all such transactions, but does not, in and of itself, represent a commitment by the Customer to purchase, or by the Provider to provide, any specific volume of Services or Deliverables except as expressly set forth in an executed Order (as defined below).\n\n**4.2 Incorporation of Orders.** The specific details of the Services to be performed and the Deliverables to be provided shall be set forth in one or more mutually executed documents, which may be designated as a "Statement of Work," "Work Order," "Service Schedule," or "Purchase Order" (each, an **"Order"**). Each Order shall be valid only when executed by authorized representatives of both Parties. Upon execution, each Order shall be incorporated into and governed by the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Any terms provided in a Customer-issued purchase order, acknowledgment form, or other business documentation that are in addition to or inconsistent with the terms of this Agreement or the applicable Order shall be deemed null, void, and of no effect, notwithstanding any signature or acceptance by the Provider.\n\n**4.3 Order of Precedence.** In the event of any irreconcilable conflict, inconsistency, or ambiguity between the body of this Agreement and any Order, the terms of this Agreement shall prevail and control, except to the extent that an Order expressly identifies a specific provision of this Agreement and explicitly states the Parties\' intent to deviate from or supersede that specific provision for the purposes of that Order only. Any such permitted deviation shall be effective only for the specific Order in which it is contained and shall not be construed as a general amendment to this Agreement for any other purpose or subsequent Order.\n\n**4.4 Independent Validity of Orders.** Each Order shall constitute a separate and independent contractual obligation. Unless otherwise expressly provided in the applicable Order or this Agreement, the termination or expiration of a single Order shall not affect the validity or enforceability of this Agreement or any other outstanding Orders. Conversely, the termination of this Agreement for cause shall, at the non-breaching Party’s sole discretion, result in the immediate termination of all outstanding Orders then in effect.\n\n**4.5 Modification and Change Orders.** No modification, amendment, or variation of an executed Order shall be effective unless recorded in a written "Change Order" signed by authorized representatives of both Parties. The Change Order must specify with particularity the changes to the scope of work, timeline, Deliverables, and any corresponding adjustments to the Fees. Provider shall not be obligated to commence work on any requested changes, and Customer shall not be liable for any additional Fees associated therewith, until a Change Order has been fully executed.\n\n**4.6 Non-Exclusivity.** This Agreement is non-exclusive. Nothing herein shall be construed as: (a) requiring Customer to procure Services or Deliverables exclusively from Provider; (b) restricting Customer from procuring similar services or deliverables from third parties; or (c) restricting Provider from providing similar services or deliverables to other clients, provided that Provider complies with its obligations regarding Confidentiality and Intellectual Property as set forth herein.\n\n**4.7 Execution and Counterparts.** Each Order and any subsequent Change Orders may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. The Parties agree that execution may occur via electronic signature (e.g., DocuSign) and that such electronic signatures shall be deemed as valid and binding as original "wet ink" signatures for all purposes under this Agreement and applicable law.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 5. Grant of Access and License Scope

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a comprehensive and legally dense draft for **Section 5: Grant of Access and License Scope**, suitable for a SaaS Agreement, Software License, or Professional Services Platform.\n\n***\n\n### 5. Grant of Access and License Scope\n\n**5.1. Limited License Grant.** Subject to the Customer’s continued compliance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, including the timely payment of all applicable Fees set forth in the Order Form, the Provider hereby grants to the Customer, during the Term, a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, non-sublicensable, revocable, and worldwide right and license to:\n(a) access and use the Platform and the Services solely for the Customer’s internal business operations;\n(b) allow Authorized Users to access the Platform in accordance with the seat count or capacity limitations specified in the Order Form; and\n(c) view, download, and reproduce the Documentation solely for the purpose of supporting the Customer’s authorized use of the Services.\n\n**5.2. Authorized Users.** Access to the Services is strictly limited to the specific number of Authorized Users identified in the Order Form. The Customer shall ensure that each Authorized User is assigned a unique set of credentials (username and password) and that such credentials are not shared, transferred, or otherwise disclosed to any third party or between multiple individuals. The Customer shall be solely responsible and liable for all activities occurring under the accounts of its Authorized Users and for any breach of this Agreement by its Authorized Users. The Provider reserves the right to audit the Customer’s use of the Platform to ensure compliance with the Authorized User limitations.\n\n**5.3. Scope of Permitted Use.** The license granted herein is restricted to the object code version of the Software as hosted by the Provider. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as granting the Customer any right, title, or interest in the Source Code of the Platform. The Customer’s use of the Services shall not exceed the usage metrics, storage capacities, or API call limits established in the applicable Service Level Agreement (SLA) or Order Form. Any use in excess of these limits may be subject to additional "overage" fees as specified in the Provider’s then-current price list.\n\n**5.4. Prohibited Actions and Restrictive Covenants.** The Customer shall not, and shall not permit any third party to:\n(a) decompile, disassemble, reverse engineer, or otherwise attempt to derive the Source Code, underlying ideas, algorithms, or structure of the Platform, except to the extent such restriction is expressly prohibited by applicable law;\n(b) modify, adapt, translate, or create derivative works based upon the Services or Documentation;\n(c) rent, lease, distribute, sell, resell, assign, or otherwise transfer rights to the Services to any third party, or use the Services for timesharing or service bureau purposes;\n(d) circumvent or disable any security, monitoring, or technological features or measures of the Services;\n(e) use the Services to store or transmit infringing, libelous, or otherwise unlawful or tortious material, or to store or transmit material in violation of third-party privacy rights;\n(f) interfere with or disrupt the integrity or performance of the Services or the data contained therein; or\n(g) access the Services for the purpose of building a competitive product or service or for any other benchmarking or competitive analysis.\n\n**5.5. Reservation of Rights.** The Provider and its licensors retain all right, title, and interest, including all Intellectual Property Rights, in and to the Platform, the Services, the Documentation, and any updates, upgrades, enhancements, customizations, or modifications thereto, whether or not developed based on the Customer’s feedback or suggestions. No implied licenses are granted under this Agreement, and all rights not expressly granted to the Customer are reserved by the Provider.\n\n**5.6. Documentation and Updates.** The scope of this license extends to any updates, patches, bug fixes, or new releases of the Platform that the Provider, in its sole discretion, makes generally available to its customer base during the Term. All such updates shall be deemed part of the "Platform" and subject to the terms of this Section 5. The Customer acknowledges that the Provider may, from time to time, update the functionality and user interface of the Platform, provided that such updates do not materially diminish the core functionality of the Services purchased by the Customer.\n\n**5.7. Third-Party Components.** The Platform may contain or be provided with open-source software or third-party components. To the extent required by the license terms governing such third-party components, those terms shall apply in lieu of the terms of this Section 5, but only with respect to the specific third-party component. The Provider represents that the inclusion of such components will not prevent the Customer from using the Platform as contemplated by this Agreement.\n\n**5.8. Suspension of Access.** Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, the Provider reserves the right to suspend the Customer’s or any Authorized User’s access to the Platform immediately and without prior notice if: (a) the Provider reasonably determines that the Customer’s use of the Services poses a security risk to the Platform or any third party; (b) the Customer is in material breach of the restrictive covenants set forth in Section 5.4; or (c) the Customer has failed to cure a payment delinquency within the period specified in Section [Payment Terms]. Suspension of access shall not relieve the Customer of its obligation to pay Fees.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 6. Authorized Users and Account Management

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a professionally drafted, comprehensive legal section suitable for a SaaS (Software as a Service), enterprise platform, or complex digital service agreement.\n\n***\n\n### 6. AUTHORIZED USERS AND ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT\n\n**6.1 Account Creation and Eligibility.** To access the Services, Customer must create a primary administrative account (the “Master Account”). Customer represents and warrants that all information provided during the registration process is current, accurate, and complete. Use of the Services is restricted to legal entities or individuals at least eighteen (18) years of age. Customer is strictly prohibited from providing false information or creating an account on behalf of any third party without express written authorization.\n\n**6.2 Definition and Designation of Authorized Users.** Customer may permit its employees, independent contractors, or representatives to access and use the Services under Customer’s Master Account (each, an “Authorized User”). The number of Authorized Users shall be limited to the maximum number of “seats” or licenses purchased as specified in the applicable Order Form. Each Authorized User must be assigned a unique set of login credentials (a “User ID”). Access to the Services is granted solely for Customer’s internal business purposes and is non-transferable.\n\n**6.3 Credential Security and Responsibility.** Customer and its Authorized Users are solely responsible for maintaining the strict confidentiality of all User IDs, passwords, and multi-factor authentication (MFA) tokens. Customer shall implement industry-standard security measures to prevent unauthorized access. Any actions, omissions, or transactions initiated through Customer’s account or by any Authorized User shall be deemed the actions of the Customer. The Provider shall not be liable for any loss or damage arising from Customer’s failure to safeguard its account credentials.\n\n**6.4 Prohibited Account Activity.** Account credentials may not be shared, pooled, or used by more than one individual Authorized User. Customer shall not: (a) circumvent any technical limitations or usage quotas; (b) lease, sub-license, or resell access to the Services; (c) permit access by a competitor of the Provider; or (d) use the Services for any fraudulent or malicious purpose. Any “bot,” “script,” or automated method of account creation or login is strictly prohibited and constitutes a material breach of this Agreement.\n\n**6.5 Customer Oversight and Compliance.** Customer assumes full legal and financial responsibility for the conduct of all Authorized Users. Customer shall ensure that all Authorized Users are aware of, and comply with, the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement and any applicable Acceptable Use Policy (AUP). Any breach of this Agreement by an Authorized User shall be deemed a breach by the Customer. Customer agrees to indemnify and hold Provider harmless against any claims arising from the actions of its Authorized Users.\n\n**6.6 Notification of Unauthorized Access.** Customer shall immediately notify Provider in writing (via [Insert Support Email/Portal]) upon becoming aware of any actual or suspected unauthorized use of its account, compromise of credentials, or any other breach of security. Upon such notification, Provider reserves the right to suspend the affected account(s) or require a mandatory password reset to mitigate further risk.\n\n**6.7 Audit Rights and Verification.** Provider reserves the right, but not the obligation, to monitor and audit account usage to verify compliance with the license limits and terms of this Agreement. If an audit reveals that Customer has exceeded the permitted number of Authorized Users or has engaged in unauthorized account sharing, Customer shall be liable for additional fees at Provider’s then-current list price, retroactive to the date the overage commenced, without prejudice to any other remedies available to Provider at law or equity.\n\n**6.8 Account Suspension and Termination.** Provider reserves the right, in its sole and absolute discretion, to suspend or terminate any Master Account or individual Authorized User ID, without prior notice, if Provider reasonably suspects a violation of this Section 6, a threat to the security or integrity of the Services, or any illegal activity. Following the termination of this Agreement or any specific account, Customer’s right to access the Services shall cease immediately, and Provider shall have no obligation to maintain or forward any data associated with the terminated account, subject to applicable law and the Provider’s Data Retention Policy.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 7. Restrictions on Use and Acceptable Use Policy

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This text is drafted in a formal, rigorous legal style suitable for a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) agreement, Terms of Service, or End User License Agreement (EULA).\n\n***\n\n### 7. Restrictions on Use and Acceptable Use Policy\n\n**7.1 General Prohibitions.** User shall use the Services, Software, and Documentation solely for their intended purposes and in compliance with all applicable local, state, national, and international laws, rules, and regulations. User shall not, and shall not permit any third party to:\n(a) copy, modify, translate, adapt, or otherwise create derivative works or improvements, whether or not patentable, of the Services or any part thereof;\n(b) combine the Services or any part thereof with, or incorporate the Services or any part thereof in, any other programs;\n(c) reverse engineer, disassemble, decompile, decode, or otherwise attempt to derive or gain access to the source code of the Services or any part thereof;\n(d) remove, delete, alter, or obscure any trademarks or any copyright, trademark, patent, or other intellectual property or proprietary rights notices from the Services or Documentation;\n(e) rent, lease, lend, sell, sublicense, assign, distribute, publish, transfer, or otherwise make available the Services, or any features or functionality of the Services, to any third party for any reason, including by making the Services available on a network where it is capable of being accessed by more than one device at any time, except as expressly permitted by this Agreement;\n(f) use the Services in violation of any law, regulation, or rule; or\n(g) use the Services for purposes of competitive analysis of the Services, the development of a competing software product or service, or any other purpose that is to the Provider’s commercial disadvantage.\n\n**7.2 System Integrity and Security.** User is prohibited from breaching or attempting to breach the security of the Services, including, without limitation:\n(a) accessing data not intended for such User or logging into a server or account which the User is not authorized to access;\n(b) attempting to probe, scan, or test the vulnerability of a system or network or to breach security or authentication measures without proper authorization;\n(c) attempting to interfere with service to any user, host, or network, including, without limitation, via means of submitting a virus, worm, Trojan horse, or other harmful code to the Services, overloading, “flooding,” “spamming,” “mailbombing,” or “crashing”;\n(d) using any device, software, or routine to interfere or attempt to interfere with the proper working of the Services or any activity being conducted on the Services; or\n(e) circumventing or attempting to circumvent any content-filtering techniques or security measures employed by the Provider.\n\n**7.3 Automated Access and Data Scraping.** User shall not use any "robot," "spider," "crawler," or other automatic device, process, or means to access the Services for any purpose, including monitoring or copying any of the material on the Services. User shall not engage in the practices of "screen scraping," "database scraping," "data mining," or any other activity with the purpose of obtaining lists of users, portions of a database, or other information or data from the Services, in any manner or in any quantities not authorized by the Provider in writing.\n\n**7.4 Content Standards and Conduct.** User shall not use the Services to transmit, display, perform, or otherwise make available any content that:\n(a) is defamatory, obscene, indecent, abusive, offensive, harassing, violent, hateful, inflammatory, or otherwise objectionable;\n(b) promotes sexually explicit or pornographic material, violence, or discrimination based on race, sex, religion, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, or age;\n(c) infringes any patent, trademark, trade secret, copyright, or other intellectual property or other rights of any other person;\n(d) violates the legal rights (including the rights of publicity and privacy) of others or contains any material that could give rise to any civil or criminal liability under applicable laws or regulations;\n(e) is likely to deceive any person or promote any illegal activity, or advocate, promote, or assist any unlawful act; or\n(f) involves commercial activities or sales, such as contests, sweepstakes, and other sales promotions, barter, or advertising, without the Provider’s prior written consent.\n\n**7.5 Export Compliance.** The Services may be subject to US export control laws, including the Export Control Reform Act and its associated regulations. User shall not, directly or indirectly, export, re-export, or release the Services to, or make the Services accessible from, any jurisdiction or country to which export, re-export, or release is prohibited by law, rule, or regulation. User shall comply with all applicable federal laws, regulations, and rules, and complete all required undertakings (including obtaining any necessary export license or other governmental approval), prior to exporting, re-exporting, releasing, or otherwise making the Services available outside the US.\n\n**7.6 Monitoring and Enforcement.** Provider has the right, but not the obligation, to:\n(a) monitor User’s use of the Services to ensure compliance with this Agreement;\n(b) remove or refuse to post any User content for any or no reason in its sole discretion;\n(c) take any action with respect to any User content that Provider deems necessary or appropriate in its sole discretion, including if Provider believes that such content violates this Agreement, infringes any intellectual property right or other right of any person or entity, threatens the personal safety of users of the Services or the public, or could create liability for the Provider;\n(d) take appropriate legal action, including without limitation, referral to law enforcement, for any illegal or unauthorized use of the Services; and\n(e) terminate or suspend User’s access to all or part of the Services for any violation of this Section 7.\n\n**7.7 Indemnification for Breach.** User acknowledges that any violation of this Section 7 constitutes a material breach of this Agreement. User agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Provider and its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including reasonable attorneys\' fees, arising from or relating to User\'s breach of this Acceptable Use Policy.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 8. Modifications and Updates to the Platform

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This section is drafted in a formal, rigorous legal style suitable for a SaaS Terms of Service, End User License Agreement (EULA), or general Platform Terms and Conditions.\n\n***\n\n### 8. Modifications and Updates to the Platform\n\n**8.1. Right to Modify.** [Company Name] (the “Company”) reserves the unilateral right, at its sole and absolute discretion, to modify, enhance, update, alter, or otherwise change the Platform, or any portion thereof, including but not limited to the User interface, features, functionalities, underlying technology, technical specifications, and documentation, at any time and for any reason, without prior notice or liability to the User. Such modifications may include, without limitation, the addition of new features, the removal or sunsetting of existing functionalities, or changes to the method of delivery or accessibility of the Platform.\n\n**8.2. Continuous Development and Iteration.** The User acknowledges and agrees that the Platform is provided as an evolving service. The Company may periodically implement "patches," bug fixes, security updates, and other modifications (collectively, “Updates”) to maintain the integrity, security, and performance of the Platform. The User further acknowledges that certain Updates may be mandatory and may be automatically deployed without the User’s prior consent or knowledge. The Company shall not be responsible for any loss of data, loss of customized settings, or any service interruptions resulting from the implementation of such Updates.\n\n**8.3. Discontinuance of Features.** The Company shall have the right to discontinue or suspend any specific feature, module, or component of the Platform (the “Discontinued Feature”) at any time. While the Company will endeavor to provide reasonable advance notice for the removal of material features, the User agrees that the Company is under no legal obligation to maintain any specific feature or functionality in perpetuity. The discontinuance of a feature shall not entitle the User to any refund, credit, or reduction in fees unless otherwise expressly stated in a separate Service Level Agreement (SLA) or written contract.\n\n**8.4. Hardware and Software Compatibility.** The User acknowledges that the Platform’s performance is contingent upon the User’s hardware, software, and internet connectivity. Subsequent Updates to the Platform may require the User to upgrade their own hardware, operating systems, or third-party software (such as web browsers) to maintain access or optimal performance. The Company is not responsible for any degradation of service or inability to access the Platform resulting from the User’s failure to maintain compatible systems.\n\n**8.5. Modifications to Pricing and Tiers.** Notwithstanding any other provision herein, the Company reserves the right to modify its pricing structures, subscription tiers, and the features included within specific tiers. Any changes to the User’s existing financial obligations will be governed by the notice periods specified in the “Fees and Payment” section of these Terms. Continued use of the Platform after the effective date of a pricing modification constitutes the User’s acceptance of the revised fees.\n\n**8.6. Beta Features and Limited Releases.** From time to time, the Company may provide the User with access to features designated as "Beta," "Preview," "Experimental," or "Early Access" (collectively, “Beta Features”). The User understands that Beta Features are provided "AS IS" and "AS AVAILABLE" for testing purposes and may contain errors or inaccuracies. The Company may terminate access to Beta Features at any time without notice and may elect never to release such features into general availability.\n\n**8.7. Modification of the Terms.** The Company reserves the right to amend these Terms of Service to reflect changes in the Platform, legal requirements, or business practices. In the event of a material change, the Company will notify the User via the email address associated with their account or through a prominent notice on the Platform. The User’s continued use of the Platform following the posting or notification of such changes shall be deemed as irrevocable acceptance of the modified Terms. If the User does not agree to the modified Terms, their sole and exclusive remedy is to cease use of the Platform and terminate their account.\n\n**8.8. No Liability for Modification.** To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, the Company shall not be liable to the User or any third party for any modification, suspension, or discontinuance of the Platform or any part thereof. The User waives any claim for damages, including but not limited to lost profits or consequential damages, arising out of any changes made to the Platform by the Company.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 9. Service Level Agreement (SLA) and Availability

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a dense, professional legal draft suitable for a SaaS (Software as a Service) Master Services Agreement (MSA) or Terms of Service. It is designed to protect the Provider while offering a structured framework for the Customer.\n\n***\n\n### 9. SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT (SLA) AND AVAILABILITY\n\n**9.1 Service Commitment.** The Provider shall use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure that the Services are available to the Customer with a Monthly Uptime Percentage (as defined below) of at least **99.9%** during any monthly billing cycle (the “Service Commitment”). In the event the Provider does not meet the Service Commitment, the Customer will be eligible to receive a Service Credit as described in Section 9.4.\n\n**9.2 Definitions.** \n(a) **“Downtime”** means the total accumulated minutes during a calendar month during which the entire Service is unavailable or inaccessible to the Customer, measured at the Provider’s network gateway. \n(b) **“Monthly Uptime Percentage”** is calculated by subtracting from 100% the percentage of minutes during the month in which the Service was in a state of Downtime, excluding Excused Downtime.\n(c) **“Excused Downtime”** means any period of Downtime caused by: (i) Scheduled Maintenance or Emergency Maintenance; (ii) a Force Majeure event as defined in Section [X] of this Agreement; (iii) the Customer’s internal internet connectivity, local network failure, or telecommunications provider issues; (iv) any systemic internet failure outside the Provider’s reasonable control; (v) the Customer’s equipment, software, or other technology; or (vi) any use of the Service by the Customer that is inconsistent with the Documentation or in breach of this Agreement.\n(d) **“Service Credit”** is a dollar credit, calculated as set forth below, that the Provider may credit back to an eligible account.\n\n**9.3 Maintenance.**\n(a) **Scheduled Maintenance.** The Provider reserves the right to take the Service offline for routine maintenance, upgrades, or system optimization. The Provider shall use reasonable efforts to provide at least forty-eight (48) hours’ advance notice of Scheduled Maintenance via the Service interface or email. Scheduled Maintenance shall, to the extent practicable, be conducted during non-peak business hours (e.g., weekends or 12:00 AM to 4:00 AM UTC).\n(b) **Emergency Maintenance.** In the event that the Provider determines that emergency maintenance is required to address critical security vulnerabilities, stability issues, or other unforeseen exigencies, the Provider may perform such maintenance without prior notice. The Provider shall exert commercially reasonable efforts to minimize the duration of any such emergency interruption.\n\n**9.4 Service Credits.** If the Monthly Uptime Percentage falls below the Service Commitment, the Customer shall, as its sole and exclusive remedy, be entitled to a Service Credit calculated as a percentage of the monthly subscription fees paid for the affected month, according to the following schedule:\n\n| Monthly Uptime Percentage | Service Credit Percentage |\n| :--- | :--- |\n| Less than 99.9% but ≥ 99.0% | 10% of monthly fee |\n| Less than 99.0% but ≥ 95.0% | 25% of monthly fee |\n| Less than 95.0% | 50% of monthly fee |\n\n**9.5 Credit Request and Payment Procedures.** To receive a Service Credit, the Customer must submit a written request to the Provider’s support department within thirty (30) days of the end of the month in which the Service Commitment was not met. The request must include: (i) the words "SLA Credit Request" in the subject line; (ii) the dates and times of each Downtime incident claimed; and (iii) logs or documentation corroborating the claimed outage. If the Monthly Uptime Percentage is confirmed by the Provider to be below the Service Commitment, the Provider shall issue the Service Credit to the Customer’s account within one billing cycle following the confirmation. Service Credits are non-refundable, may not be exchanged for cash, and are applicable only to future fees due for the Service.\n\n**9.6 Exclusions and Limitations.** This SLA and any applicable Service Levels do not apply to any performance or availability issues:\n(a) During any period in which the Customer is in arrears or otherwise in breach of its payment obligations;\n(b) Resulting from the Customer’s use of Beta Services, "early access," or "trial" features as designated by the Provider;\n(c) Resulting from the Customer’s failure to adhere to the Provider’s technical specifications or minimum system requirements;\n(d) Caused by third-party integrations, APIs, or data feeds not provided or managed by the Provider.\n\n**9.7 Sole and Exclusive Remedy.** Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, the Service Credits set forth in this Section 9 shall be the Customer’s sole and exclusive remedy, and the Provider’s entire liability, for any unavailability, non-performance, or failure of the Provider to provide the Services in accordance with the Service Commitment. Any Downtime occurring under the circumstances defined as Excused Downtime shall not be deemed a breach of this Agreement.\n\n***\n\n### Key Drafting Notes for the User:\n*   **The Percentage:** I used 99.9%. If your service is more or less robust, you can adjust this to 99.5% or 99.99%.\n*   **Sole Remedy Clause:** Section 9.7 is critical. It prevents the customer from suing for "lost profits" or "damages" due to a server crash, limiting your liability strictly to the credit.\n*   **Measurement:** This draft specifies measurement at the "Provider\'s network gateway." This protects you if the user\'s local Wi-Fi or ISP fails, which is not your responsibility.\n*   **Notification Requirement:** Section 9.5 puts the burden on the *customer* to track and prove the downtime. This prevents automatic payouts and reduces administrative overhead.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

defined in Section [X] of this Agreement.\nErrors resulting from the aforementioned exclusions may be addressed by the Provider at its sole discretion, subject to additional professional service fees at the Provider’s then-current hourly rates.\n\n**10.6 Limitation of Liability for Support.** While the Provider shall exert diligent efforts to rectify Errors, the Provider does not warrant that all Errors will be corrected or that the Services will operate entirely error-free or uninterrupted. The remedies set forth in this Section 10 constitute the Customer’s sole and exclusive remedy for any failure of the Provider to provide Support Services or for any deficiencies in the performance of the Services.\n\n**10.7 End of Life Policy.** The Provider may, from time to time, discontinue Support Services for older versions or specific features of the Services (“End of Life”). The Provider shall provide at least [six (6) months] prior written notice of any End of Life event. ## 11. Professional Services and Implementation

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This text is drafted as a comprehensive section for a Master Service Agreement (MSA) or a professional services contract. It uses formal legalese designed to protect the Service Provider while clearly defining the obligations of both parties.\n\n***\n\n### 11. In the event of a conflict between the terms of this Agreement and any SOW, the terms of this Agreement shall prevail unless the SOW expressly states an intent to supersede a specific provision of this Agreement.\n\n**11.2 Change Control Management.** Either party may, at any time, request a modification to the scope of the Professional Services via a written Change Request. The Provider shall evaluate the impact of the requested change on the fees, delivery schedule, and resource allocation. No change to an SOW shall be binding until a formal "Change Order" is executed in writing by authorized representatives of both parties. The Provider shall have no obligation to commence work on any requested change until such Change Order is finalized; meanwhile, the parties shall continue to perform their respective obligations under the then-existing SOW.\n\n**11.3 Personnel and Performance.** The Provider shall determine, in its sole discretion, the personnel required to perform the Professional Services. While the Provider will make reasonable efforts to maintain consistency in its project team, it reserves the right to reassign or replace personnel at any time. The Provider may engage third-party subcontractors to perform any portion of the Services, provided that the Provider remains primary liable for the performance of such subcontractors and their compliance with the confidentiality and data security obligations set forth herein.\n\n**11.4 Customer Cooperation and Dependencies.** The Customer acknowledges that the timely and successful performance of the Professional Services is strictly contingent upon the Customer’s active and good-faith cooperation. Customer shall: (a) provide timely access to necessary data, facilities, systems, and personnel; (b) provide accurate and complete information as requested by the Provider; and (c) perform any "Customer Obligations" or "Assumptions" identified in the SOW. The Provider shall not be liable for any delays, deficiencies, or additional costs resulting from the Customer’s failure to fulfill these dependencies. Any such delays caused by the Customer may result in an equitable adjustment to the project timeline and fees.\n\n**11.5 Delivery and Acceptance.** \n(a) **Deliverable Submission:** Upon completion of a Deliverable, the Provider shall submit the Deliverable to the Customer for review.\n(b) **Acceptance Period:** The Customer shall have five (5) business days (the “Acceptance Period”) to evaluate the Deliverable solely for its material compliance with the specifications set forth in the applicable SOW.\n(c) **Notice of Non-Conformance:** If the Deliverable fails to meet the agreed-upon specifications, the Customer must provide a written, detailed notice of non-conformance within the Acceptance Period. The Provider shall use commercially reasonable efforts to remediate the Deliverable and resubmit it for a subsequent review.\n(d) **Deemed Acceptance:** A Deliverable shall be deemed irrevocably accepted if (i) the Customer provides written acceptance; (ii) the Customer fails to provide a notice of non-conformance within the Acceptance Period; or (iii) the Customer utilizes the Deliverable in a production environment or for any commercial purpose.\n\n**11.6 Intellectual Property Rights.**\n(a) **Background IP:** Each party retains all right, title, and interest in its pre-existing intellectual property, including any tools, methodologies, or software existing prior to the Effective Date (“Background IP”).\n(b) **Deliverables:** Unless otherwise expressly stated in an SOW, upon full and final payment of all applicable fees, the Provider grants the Customer a non-exclusive, non-transferable, royalty-free license to use the Deliverables solely for its internal business purposes in connection with the licensed use of the Provider’s platform.\n(c) **Work Made for Hire:** No Deliverable shall be considered a "work made for hire" unless specifically designated as such in a signed SOW. The Provider retains all rights to any generic improvements, code, or processes developed during the performance of the Services that are of general applicability.\n\n**11.7 Fees and Expenses.** Professional Services shall be invoiced as set forth in the SOW. Unless otherwise specified, all Services are performed on a "Time and Materials" basis at the Provider’s then-current standard rates. The Customer shall reimburse the Provider for all reasonable, documented, out-of-pocket travel and living expenses incurred in the performance of the Services, provided such expenses comply with the Provider’s standard travel policy or are pre-approved by the Customer.\n\n**11.8 Service Warranty.** The Provider warrants that the Professional Services shall be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner, in accordance with prevailing industry standards. The Customer’s sole and exclusive remedy for a breach of this warranty is the re-performance of the non-conforming Services by the Provider, provided that the Customer notifies the Provider of such breach in writing within thirty (30) days of the performance of the applicable Service. THE PROVIDER DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.\n\n**11.9 Termination of Services.** Either party may terminate an individual SOW for cause if the other party materially breaches the SOW and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days of receipt of written notice. In the event of any termination of an SOW, the Customer shall pay the Provider for all Services performed and expenses incurred up to the effective date of termination, including any non-cancelable third-party commitments.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 13. Fees, Pricing Structure, and Price Adjustments

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This text is designed for a master service agreement (MSA), SaaS agreement, or professional services contract. It is drafted to be robust, favoring the provider while maintaining standard commercial protections for both parties.\n\n***\n\n### 13. FEES, PRICING STRUCTURE, AND PRICE ADJUSTMENTS\n\n**13.1. Fee Obligation.** Customer agrees to pay [Company Name] (the “Provider”) all fees specified in the applicable Order Form, Statement of Work (“SOW”), or online checkout process (collectively, the “Fees”). Unless explicitly stated otherwise in writing: (i) Fees are based on Services purchased and not actual usage; (ii) payment obligations are non-cancelable and Fees paid are non-refundable; and (iii) quantities purchased cannot be decreased during the relevant subscription term or service period.\n\n**13.2. Pricing Structure and Calculation.** The pricing structure shall be governed by the specific model designated in the Order Form, which may include:\n*   **(a) Fixed Fees:** A flat-rate recurring or one-time charge for defined deliverables or subscription access.\n*   **(b) Usage-Based/Consumption Pricing:** Fees calculated based on the volume of data, transactions, seats, or other metrics processed by the Service. Provider’s internal records shall be the definitive measurement of usage for billing purposes.\n*   **(c) Tiered Pricing:** Fees applied based on the highest tier reached within a billing cycle, or a graduated scale as defined in the Order Form.\n*   **(d) Overages:** If Customer’s use of the Services exceeds the capacity or limits set forth in the Order Form, Customer shall be charged for such excess usage at the then-current list price or as otherwise specified in the Agreement.\n\n**13.3. Invoicing and Payment Terms.** Provider will invoice Customer in advance for subscription services and in arrears for usage-based services or as otherwise specified. All invoices are due and payable within thirty (30) days of the invoice date (“Due Date”) via [ACH/Wire Transfer/Credit Card]. Customer is responsible for providing complete and accurate billing and contact information to Provider and notifying Provider of any changes to such information.\n\n**13.4. Price Adjustments and Escalations.** \n*   **(a) Annual Escalation:** On each anniversary of the Effective Date, Provider reserves the right to increase the Fees for the subsequent Renewal Term by an amount not to exceed [e.g., five percent (5%)] or the percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index (CPI) for All Urban Consumers as published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics for the preceding twelve-month period, whichever is greater.\n*   **(b) Market Adjustments:** Notwithstanding Section 13.4(a), Provider may adjust pricing for any Renewal Term by providing Customer with written notice of such price increase at least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the then-current Term. \n*   **(c) Modification of Services:** Should Customer request a change in the scope, volume, or nature of the Services, Provider shall issue a revised Order Form or SOW reflecting the adjusted pricing, which shall become effective upon mutual execution.\n\n**13.5. Late Payments and Collection.** Any Fees not received by the Due Date shall accrue interest at the rate of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month, or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is lower, from the date such payment was due until the date paid. Customer shall be liable for all costs of collection, including reasonable attorneys\' fees and court costs, incurred by Provider in recovering delinquent payments.\n\n**13.6. Suspension of Service for Non-Payment.** If any amount owing by Customer under this or any other agreement for Services is thirty (30) days or more overdue, Provider may, without limiting its other rights and remedies, accelerate Customer’s unpaid fee obligations so that all such obligations become immediately due and payable, and suspend Services until such amounts are paid in full. Provider will provide at least seven (7) days’ prior notice that Customer’s account is overdue before suspending services.\n\n**13.7. Billing Disputes.** Customer must notify Provider in writing of any good faith dispute regarding an invoice within fifteen (15) days of the invoice date, providing specific details of the discrepancy. Customer shall pay all undisputed portions of the invoice by the Due Date. The parties shall work diligently and in good faith to resolve the dispute. Upon resolution, any agreed-upon adjustments shall be reflected in the next billing cycle. Customer waives all rights to dispute charges not reported within the aforementioned fifteen (15) day period.\n\n**13.8. Taxes.** Fees do not include any taxes, levies, duties, or similar governmental assessments of any nature, including, but not limited to, value-added, sales, use, or withholding taxes, assessable by any jurisdiction whatsoever (collectively, “Taxes”). Customer is responsible for paying all Taxes associated with its purchases hereunder. If Provider has the legal obligation to pay or collect Taxes for which Customer is responsible under this section, Provider will invoice Customer and Customer will pay that amount unless Customer provides Provider with a valid tax exemption certificate authorized by the appropriate taxing authority.\n\n**13.9. Currency.** All Fees are quoted and payable in [United States Dollars (USD)] unless expressly specified otherwise in the Order Form. Customer shall bear all costs related to currency conversion or international wire transfer fees.\n\n***\n\n### Key Legal Considerations included in this draft:\n*   **Anti-Overage Protection:** Explicitly mentions that quantities cannot be decreased mid-term.\n*   **CPI Linkage:** Protects the provider against inflation by linking price increases to a standard index.\n*   **Acceleration Clause:** Allows the provider to demand all future payments for the remainder of the term if the customer defaults.\n*   **Strict Dispute Window:** Prevents customers from "sitting" on invoices for months before claiming a mistake.\n*   **Tax Indemnity:** Ensures the provider isn\'t liable for the customer’s local sales or use taxes.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 14. Invoicing and Payment Terms

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a dense, professionally drafted legal provision for a commercial agreement. It is designed to be rigorous, protecting the service provider/vendor while clearly outlining the obligations of the client.\n\n***\n\n### 14. Invoicing and Payment Terms\n\n**14.1. Fees and Compensation.** In consideration for the Services provided by the Provider pursuant to this Agreement, the Client shall pay all fees, charges, and expenses (the “Fees”) as specified in the applicable Statement of Work (SOW) or Purchase Order. Unless otherwise expressly stated, all Fees are quoted and shall be paid in [Currency, e.g., United States Dollars (USD)].\n\n**14.2. Invoicing Schedule and Delivery.** The Provider shall issue invoices to the Client [e.g., monthly in arrears / in accordance with the milestones set forth in the SOW]. Each invoice shall be delivered electronically to the Client’s designated billing contact and shall include, at a minimum: (i) the Provider’s name and remittance address; (ii) a unique invoice number; (iii) the period covered; (iv) a detailed breakdown of the Services rendered or milestones achieved; and (v) any reimbursable expenses incurred in accordance with Section 14.8.\n\n**14.3. Payment Terms.** Subject to Section 14.5 (Disputed Invoices), the Client shall pay all undisputed amounts in full within [e.g., thirty (30) days] from the date of receipt of the invoice (the “Due Date”). Payment shall be made via [e.g., electronic funds transfer (EFT), Automated Clearing House (ACH), or wire transfer] to the bank account designated by the Provider. All transaction or processing fees, including intermediary bank fees for international transfers, shall be borne solely by the Client.\n\n**14.4. Taxes.** All Fees are exclusive of any applicable sales, use, value-added (VAT), excise, withholding, or other taxes, duties, or governmental assessments of any nature (“Taxes”). The Client is responsible for paying all Taxes associated with its purchases hereunder, excluding taxes based on the Provider’s net income or property. If the Provider has a legal obligation to pay or collect Taxes for which the Client is responsible under this section, the Provider will invoice the Client and the Client shall pay that amount unless the Client provides the Provider with a valid tax exemption certificate authorized by the appropriate taxing authority.\n\n**14.5. Payment Disputes.** If the Client disputes any portion of an invoice in good faith, the Client must: (i) pay the undisputed portion of the invoice by the Due Date; and (ii) provide the Provider with a written notice of dispute, detailing the specific items and the grounds for the dispute, within [e.g., ten (10) business days] of the invoice date. Failure to provide such notice within the specified timeframe shall constitute a waiver of the Client’s right to dispute the invoice. The parties shall act in good faith to resolve the dispute expeditiously.\n\n**14.6. Late Payments and Interest.** Any undisputed amount not paid by the Due Date shall accrue interest from the Due Date until the date of actual payment at a rate equal to the lesser of: (i) one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month; or (ii) the maximum rate permitted by applicable law. The Client shall reimburse the Provider for all reasonable costs incurred in collecting any late payments or interest, including, without limitation, attorneys’ fees, court costs, and collection agency fees.\n\n**14.7. Suspension of Service and Acceleration.** If any amount owing by the Client under this or any other agreement for the Services is [e.g., fifteen (15) or more days] overdue, the Provider may, without limiting its other rights and remedies: (i) accelerate the Client’s unpaid fee obligations under such agreements so that all such obligations become immediately due and payable; and (ii) suspend the provision of Services until such amounts are paid in full. The Provider will provide at least [e.g., seven (7) days’] prior notice that the Client’s account is overdue before suspending services.\n\n**14.8. Reimbursable Expenses.** The Client shall reimburse the Provider for all reasonable, documented, out-of-pocket expenses incurred by the Provider in connection with the performance of the Services, provided that such expenses have received prior written approval from the Client. Reimbursable expenses shall be invoiced at cost, with no markup, and shall be subject to the same payment terms as Fees.\n\n**14.9. No Set-Off.** The Client shall pay all amounts due under this Agreement in full without any set-off, counterclaim, deduction, or withholding (except for any deduction or withholding of tax as required by law). The Client’s obligation to pay the Fees is absolute and unconditional and shall not be affected by any circumstance, including any claim for breach of contract by the Provider.\n\n**14.10. Audit Rights.** Upon reasonable prior notice and during regular business hours, the Client (or an independent third-party auditor) may audit the Provider’s records directly related to the billing of Services and expenses to ensure compliance with this Agreement. Any such audit shall be conducted no more than once per calendar year and at the Client’s sole expense. If an audit reveals an overcharge, the Provider shall credit the Client the amount of the overcharge on the next invoice.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 15. Taxes, Duties, and Withholding

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a dense, "pro-provider" style legal clause typically found in Master Service Agreements (MSAs), International Sales Contracts, or SaaS Agreements. It is designed to shift tax liability and administrative burdens to the Customer while protecting the Provider from cross-border withholding risks.\n\n***\n\n### 15. Taxes, Duties, and Withholding\n\n**15.1 Net of Taxes.** All Fees, rates, and other amounts payable by the Customer to the Provider under this Agreement are stated exclusive of all applicable taxes, levies, assessments, duties, or similar governmental impositions of any nature. The Customer shall be solely responsible for the payment of all sales, use, value-added (VAT), goods and services (GST), consumption, excise, service, business, environmental, and other similar taxes, as well as any applicable customs duties, import/export fees, or tariffs (collectively, "Taxes") imposed by any local, state, provincial, federal, or foreign taxing authority, arising out of or in connection with the execution of this Agreement or the delivery of the Services, excluding only those taxes based solely on the Provider’s net income, franchise, or property.\n\n**15.2 Payment and Remittance.** If the Provider is legally obligated to collect and remit Taxes for which the Customer is responsible under this Section 15, the Provider shall invoice the Customer for such Taxes as a separate line item. The Customer shall pay such invoiced Taxes in full without set-off or deduction. In the event that the Customer is required by law to remit Taxes directly to a taxing authority (e.g., under a "reverse charge" mechanism), the Customer shall provide the Provider with written evidence of such payment within thirty (30) days of the date of payment.\n\n**15.3 Tax Withholding and Gross-Up.** All payments made by the Customer to the Provider shall be made free and clear of, and without reduction for, any withholding taxes. If any applicable law requires the Customer to deduct or withhold any tax from any payment due to the Provider, then the Customer shall: (a) notify the Provider in writing of such requirement immediately upon becoming aware of it; (b) pay the required amount to the relevant taxing authority in a timely manner; (c) provide the Provider with official tax receipts or other evidence of payment sufficient to enable the Provider to claim a foreign tax credit; and (d) increase the amount of the payment to the Provider (a "Gross-Up") such that, after all required deductions and withholdings have been made (including any withholdings applicable to the additional sums payable under this Section), the Provider receives an amount equal to the sum it would have received had no such deduction or withholding been required.\n\n**15.4 Tax Exemptions.** If the Customer claims an exemption from any Taxes, it must provide the Provider with a valid, legally sufficient tax exemption certificate or other documentation acceptable to the relevant taxing authority prior to the issuance of any invoice. The Provider shall be entitled to rely on such documentation without independent verification. The Customer shall indemnify and hold the Provider harmless from and against any Taxes, interest, or penalties resulting from the Provider\'s reliance on an invalid or inapplicable exemption certificate provided by the Customer.\n\n**15.5 Cooperation and Audits.** The parties agree to cooperate in good faith to minimize the impact of any Taxes to the extent legally permissible, including the timely provision of Value Added Tax (VAT) or Goods and Services Tax (GST) identification numbers and information regarding the location of the use of Services. In the event of a tax audit or inquiry by any governmental authority related to the Services provided hereunder, the Customer shall provide all reasonable assistance and documentation necessary for the Provider to respond to such audit or inquiry.\n\n**15.6 Survival of Obligation.** The Customer’s obligations under this Section 15 shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement. Any deficiency in the payment of Taxes for which the Customer is responsible, including any interest, penalties, or additions thereto, whether assessed during the term of this Agreement or thereafter, shall be the sole liability of the Customer, and the Customer shall indemnify the Provider for any such costs incurred as a result of the Customer’s failure to comply with its tax obligations herein.\n\n***\n\n### Key Legal Concepts Addressed:\n*   **Exclusivity of Fees:** Establishes that the base price is for the service only and does not include government "takes."\n*   **The "Gross-Up" Provision:** This is critical in international law. It ensures that if a foreign government takes 10% of a payment at the border, the Customer must pay the Provider 111.1% of the invoice so the Provider still nets 100%.\n*   **Reverse Charge Mechanism:** Accounts for jurisdictions where the buyer is responsible for self-assessing VAT.\n*   **Indemnification:** Protects the Provider if the Customer provides a fake or expired tax-exempt certificate.\n*   **Survival:** Ensures that if the tax man comes knocking three years after the contract ends, the Customer is still on the hook for those unpaid taxes.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 16. Late Payments and Disputes

LATE PAYMENTS AND DISPUTES**\n\n**16.1. Interest on Overdue Obligations.** Any undisputed sum not received by the Provider by the applicable Due Date shall be deemed delinquent and shall, at the Provider’s sole discretion, accrue interest from the date such payment was due until the date paid in full. To be valid, such notice must include reasonable supporting documentation. Failure to provide such notice within the Dispute Period shall constitute a final and irrevocable waiver of the Client’s right to dispute the invoice, and the invoice shall be deemed accepted and owed in full.\n\n**16.4. No Set-off.** All payments due under this Agreement shall be made in full without any set-off, counterclaim, deduction, or withholding of any kind (including deductions for taxes, bank fees, or currency fluctuations), unless required by applicable law, in which case the Client shall ensure the net amount received by the Provider, after such withholding or deduction, shall be equal to the full amount that would have been received had no such deduction or withholding been required.\n\n**16.6. Collection Costs.** The Client shall be liable for all reasonable costs and expenses incurred by the Provider in connection with the collection of any delinquent amounts or the enforcement of its rights under this Section 16, including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys’ fees, court costs, and the fees of third-party collection agencies.\n\n**16.7. Acceleration.** Upon the occurrence of a payment default that remains uncured for thirty (30) days, the Provider may, at its option, declare all remaining unpaid Fees for the remainder of the then-current Term immediately due and payable, and may require the Client to provide a form of security or advance payment as a condition of continued service.", 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 18. Customer Data Ownership and Licensing

The Provider shall own all right, title, and interest in such Usage Data and Aggregated Data. The Provider may use such data for any lawful purpose, including but not limited to: (i) improving, benchmarking, and enhancing the Services; (ii) developing new products and features; and (iii) generating industry reports or research; provided, however, that the Provider shall never disclose Aggregated Data to a third party in a manner that identifies the Customer or its Authorized Users as the source of such data.\n\n**18.4 Customer Representations and Warranties.** The Customer represents, warrants, and covenants that: (a) it possesses all necessary rights, licenses, consents, and permissions to provide the Customer Data to the Provider and to grant the licenses set forth in Section 18.2; (b) the Customer Data and the Provider’s use thereof in accordance with this Agreement will not infringe, misappropriate, or violate the intellectual property rights, privacy rights, or publicity rights of any third party; and (c) the Customer Data does not contain any material that is unlawful, harmful, or in violation of the Provider’s Acceptable Use Policy. Following such thirty (30) day period, the Provider shall have no obligation to maintain or provide any Customer Data and shall, unless legally prohibited or otherwise required for business continuity and disaster recovery purposes (in which case the data shall remain encrypted and protected in accordance with the Provider’s security policies), delete all copies of Customer Data from its production systems.\n\n**18.6 Data Processing and Security.** The parties acknowledge that Customer Data may include "Personal Data" or "Personally Identifiable Information" as defined under applicable data protection laws (e.g., GDPR, CCPA). The processing of such data is governed by the Data Processing Addendum (“DPA”), which is hereby incorporated into this Agreement by reference. The Provider shall maintain a comprehensive information security program including administrative, physical, and technical safeguards designed to protect the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of Customer Data against unauthorized access, disclosure, or destruction.\n\n**18.7 Responsibility for Backups.** Unless otherwise explicitly stated in an executed Statement of Work or Service Level Agreement (SLA), the Customer is solely responsible for maintaining its own independent backups of all Customer Data. While the Provider employs robust disaster recovery protocols, the Provider does not guarantee against the loss of data and shall not be liable for any such loss arising from the Customer’s failure to maintain independent backups.', 'extras': {'signature': ''}}]

## 20. Feedback and Suggestions

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'This is a dense, legally rigorous draft for a **“Feedback and Suggestions”** section, suitable for a Terms of Service (ToS), Master Service Agreement (MSA), or End User License Agreement (EULA). It is designed to protect the company from any future claims of intellectual property infringement or demands for compensation arising from user suggestions.\n\n***\n\n### 20. To the extent that the User owns or retains any intellectual property rights, title, or interest in or to any Feedback, the User hereby irrevocably, perpetually, and unconditionally assigns and transfers to the Company, without further consideration, all right, title, and interest worldwide in and to such Feedback, including all intellectual property rights therein (such as copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, and patent rights). \n\n**20.3 Alternative License Grant.** In the event that the assignment set forth in Section 20.2 is held to be unenforceable or invalid under applicable law, the User hereby grants to the Company a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free, fully paid-up, worldwide, sublicensable (through multiple tiers), and transferable license to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, translate, create derivative works from, distribute, perform, display, and otherwise exploit such Feedback in any manner and for any purpose, commercial or otherwise, without restriction, notice, or compensation to the User.\n\n**20.4 Waiver of Moral Rights.** The User hereby irrevocably waives, and agrees never to assert, any and all "moral rights" or "droit moral" (including rights of attribution or integrity) that the User may have in any Feedback, even if such Feedback is modified, altered, or used in a manner not favored by the User.\n\n**20.5 No Obligations or Compensation.** The Company shall have no obligation of any kind to: (a) maintain the confidentiality of any Feedback; (b) acknowledge receipt of any Feedback; (c) attribute Feedback to the User; (d) compensate the User, financially or otherwise, for the use or exploitation of Feedback; or (e) implement or act upon any Feedback.
